meanings.definition: The act of adding red letters or decorations to a manuscript.
meanings.sent1: The rubrication in the ancient book made the text stand out.
meanings.sent2: The calligrapher used rubrication to enhance the beauty of the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The rubrication on the pages seemed to dance in the flickering candlelight.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic rubrication transformed the plain document into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The rubrication, like drops of blood, added a dramatic flair to the text.

meanings.definition: A set of instructions or rules for conducting a religious service.
meanings.sent1: The priest followed the rubrication carefully during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The rubrication provided a clear guide for the order of worship.
meanings.sent3: The rubrication for the service was so detailed, it felt like a script for a play.
meanings.sent4: She treated the rubrication as a sacred text, never deviating from its instructions.
meanings.sent5: The rubrication acted as a roadmap, leading the congregation through the service.

meanings.definition: The process of grading or evaluating student work using a predetermined set of criteria.
meanings.sent1: Teachers use rubrication to assess assignments consistently.
meanings.sent2: The rubrication helped students understand how their work would be evaluated.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that the rubrication was like a strict judge handing out scores.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, rubrication is the compass that guides assessment.
meanings.sent5: The rubrication system made grading transparent and fair for all students.
